title: Sephora Savings Event Spring Sale 2025: Best in Makeup
description: Sephora Savings Event Spring Sale 2025 is here starting on 4/4 for Rouge Members! Rounding up the best in makeup with my top recommendations in each category.
author: Sabrina
excerpt: Sephora Savings Event Spring Sale 2025 is here starting on 4/4 for Rouge Members! Rounding up the best in makeup with my top recommendations in each category.
text: I’ve been MIA for the past couple of weeks as I just moved from Tampa to Miami! We’ve all been living out of boxes and moving boxes as we packed everything up for our big move. We are finally in South Beach! I’ll share more soon but you can see a sneak peek of our new place on my LIFE UPDATES highlights on Instagram if you’re curious! We are slowly but surely settling into our new place and getting everything sorted. Lots of reviews and more beauty content coming your way as I get back into the swing of things. I really miss blogging and trying out new beauty products. I can’t wait to get back into my routine. The Sephora Savings Event is here this month running from 4/4 through 4/14! Rouge gets first access starting this Friday instore or online with code SAVEMORE. Dates for access: Rouge Members save 20% 4/4 through 4/14 VIB Members save 15% off 4/8 through 4/14 Insiders save 10% off 4/8 through 4/14 All Sephora Collection is 30% off There are so many great makeup launches these days. I’ll share my absolute tried and true favorites by category and if there’s something new that I tried and loved recently I’ll also list those below. Best Primers I’m still not a traditional primer kind of person, but I will use a multi-tasking primer/moisturizer/spf underneath makeup. I still love the Bobbi Brown Vitamin Enriched Face Base and the Charlotte Tilbury Invisible UV Flawless Primer with SPF 50. If I want something to mix in or add a bit of glow as a base, I still swear by the Charlotte Tilbury Hollywood Flawless Filter (I use Shade 3 or 4.5, swatches here) as a staple, but these days I’ve been really loving the Dior Forever Star Filter (I use Shade 3, swatches + comparisons here) and Saie Glowy Super Gel in Roseglow. I also really like the new Supergoop! Glowscreen Soft-Radiance Drops which is a mineral formula with SPF40. I’ve been testing out the darker shade Golden Hour but might also pick up Sunrise to try. Best Concealer Two favorites I will always repurchase are the Natasha Denona Hy-Glam Concealer for full coverage (still creamy and very easy to blend) or the YSL Touche Eclat. The other ones shown above are also ones I’ve loved, but right now I’ve been sticking to the Natasha Denona one most of the time. I have been very curious about the Haus Labs Triclone Skin Tech Concealer and will be picking it up during the sale. Best Foundation/Skin Tints I love that there wide range of base formulas and coverage for every skin type and preference. My top three most-used foundations from Sephora are the Armani Luminous Silk Foundation (I wear Shade 6.5), Dior Forever Skin Perfect Foundation Stick (I wear 2.5N or 3N, swatches here) and the Westman Atelier Vital Skin Foundation Stick (my shades range from V, VI to VII depending how tan I am). I also really love the It Cosmetics CC+ Nude Glow. For a more natural looking tint I love the Summer Fridays Skin Tint and Fenty Eaze Drop Blurring Skin Tints. Best Setting Products My go-to powder is the Charlotte Tilbury Airbrush Flawless Finish Setting Powder. For a loose setting powder I think the Laura Mercier Translucent Loose Setting Powder remains a classic and I really love the Makeup by Mario Setting Products. I love the way his SurrealSkin Soft Blur Setting Powder looks on the skin (definitely splurge on his puff). His SurrealSkin Soft Setting Spray is also a really good one. The old version of the Givenchy Prisme Libre was 10/10 but I haven’t looked at the new one after reading so many bad reviews. I do have a few newer ones on my wishlist that I want to check out during the sale including the Givenchy Prisme Libre Pressed Powder, YSL All Hours Hyper Blur Loose and maybe the Kosas Cloud Set Loose Powder. Best Bronzers/Contour The best contour products I’ve tried from Sephora are the Rare Beauty Warm Wishes Effortless Cream Bronzer Stick and Westman Atelier Face Trace Contour Stick. These have the best undertones for my skin tone, most other brands run too warm or cool. Swatches + comparisons in this post here. For a bronzer my favorite has been the Armani Luminous Silk Creamy Bronzing Powder in 100 or 110 (review here). I also still really love the Hourglass Ambient Lighting Bronzer for that soft glowy bronze. Gucci Sun-Kissed Glow Bronzer in Shade 3 is also a really good one. The Ilia Sunshift Weightless Silky Cream Bronzer is one of my favorite shimmery cream bronzers for the color + finish, but it’s more like a highlighter on my skin rather than a bronzer due to the shimmers. Swatches here. There are lots of new bronzer formulas I have on my list to try. They’ve been packed away in moving boxes but I hope to review them before the sale ends! I do have the Dior Forever Nude Jumbo Bronzer in 20 and 30. I am curious about the new Haus Labs Powder Sculpt Velvet Powder Bronzers, hoping that one of the new shades will work for me! Best Blush Formulas I think I could write an entire series dedicated to blushes. I’m still 100% a powder blush lover. If I could only pick 3 powder blushes to recommend I think the YSL Make Me Blush Powder Blush (review + swatches here) is one of the best new powder blush formulas. I also still really love the Gucci Luminous Matte Beauty Blush (reviewed here and here) and Dior Rosy Glow Blush is also a favorite (swatches here). Out of the newer blush launches I think the new Tower28 GetSet Blur + Set Matte Powder Blush (swatched here) and Saie SuperSuede Powder Blushes (tried on here) are solid wins. Formulas wear beautifully. I don’t love all the shades they launched but I do really love the colors I tried. The Tower28 is a true matte finish but doesn’t look flat. The Saie SuperSuede has more of a satin finish and it’s easy to layer and blend, but overall has a soft vibe. For a cream/liquid blush formula Armani Luminous Silk Cheek Tints, Natasha Denona Hy-Blush (review here) and Huda Blush Filter (one reviewed here) are my favorites for the formula and color selection. I plan on buying some of the new Westman Atelier blush duos during the sale to try! Highlighters I Love I’ve been more into glowy blush for a glow rather than a traditional highlighter, but I really love the Dior Forever Glow Maximizers (Nude and Peachy are my favorites, swatches here). The Westman Atelier Super Loaded Tint Peau de Peche highlighter is also a staple – champagne bronzey tones are hard to find for me and this one is just perfect. Swatches in this post here. Eyeshadow Favorites My eyeshadow picks are my same go-to’s lately. I feel the need to find something fresh and new to change up my beauty looks, but my top 5 eyeshadow palettes are the Tom Ford Eye Color Quad in Peach Glamour, Tom Ford Golden Hour, Makeup by Mario Master Mattes, Natasha Denona I Need a Warm Nude and the Too Faced Born This Way Natural Nudes. If I had to pick just one eyeshadow brand to wear Natasha Denona wins hands down. Her palettes are the ones I reach for nearly every single day. For single shadows I still swear by the Charlotte Tilbury Eyes to Mesmerize (I wear Rose Gold the most) and the Armani Eye Tints in 44S Blush or 22M are my favorites. I think I might pick up a couple more colors during the sale. Eye Makeup Staples (Liner, Brow, Mascara) My favorite eyeliners actually aren’t available at Sephora (they’re from Sisley or Victoria Beckham Beauty). But for brows there are TONS of great options at Sephora. I love Benefit Precisely My Brow (I wear Shade 3), Anastasia Beverly Hills Brow Wiz (Caramel) and Glossier Boy Brow Arch Pencil (Cool Brown) the best for brows. My most-used pencils are from ABH because Caramel is the best color for me. My natural hair color is almost black but my brows are a lot lighter so matching something to my hair usually ends up looking too harsh but Caramel is the best color for me. As much as I love the Glossier one there’s not much product in the pencil and I think I used an entire pencil in 3 weeks. Best Lip Liners Now onto my favorite category: lips! I love a good lip pencil and layering lip products are always fun, but these days I have been so low maintenance I usually wear 1 product on my lips at a time. I still think the Charlotte Tilbury Lip Cheat is the best lip liner for my lip tone. I know everyone probably already owns Pillow Talk, but it’s still my go-to favorite pink neutral (swatches here). I’ve also been really impressed with the Fenty Trace’d Out Longwear Lip Liners (swatches here), Huda Lip Contour 2.0 (swatches here), Glossier Lip Line (swatches of my picks here) and Tom Ford Long Wear Lip Liners (swatches here). If I could only recommend 2 to try during the sale, I’d say splurge on the Tom Ford or Fenty options. I did pick up some of the Merit Signature Lip Sheer Lip Liners but with my life in moving boxes this past month I haven’t had a chance to try them. Best Lipsticks My top 6 lipstick formulas at Sephora include the Tom Ford Lip Color (new formula + colors reviewed here), Fenty Gloss Bomb Stix (I prefer the cream ones reviewed here), Prada Monochrome Soft Matte (I love P158 Meranti), YSL Rouge Pur Couture (swatches + review here), Westman Atelier Lip Suede (review here and also here) and the NARS Afterglow Sensual Shine Hydrating Lipstick. Best Lip Balms/Oils YSL makes some of the prettiest tinted lip balms, I love all the formulas, but my favorite is the Candy Glaze (review here and new shades here) or Candy Glow (swatches here) for the best lasting power, pigment and shine. For a tinted lip balm or oil I have so many favorites. For a squeeze tube format balm the Summer Fridays Lip Butter is always in my bag. I have all the colors but love the Vanilla Beige the most (swatches here). The Gisou Honey Infused Hydrating Lip Oils are super fun but the pigment is ultra sheer (new shades in action here). For a twist up/click style balm I do still really love the Tarte Maracuja Juicy Lips (all the formulas are great) and the Hourglass Phantom Volumizing Glossy Balm colors cannot be beat (new shades reviewed here). Best Lip Gloss For lip gloss I’m still sticking to my top 5 go-to’s! The Fenty Gloss Bomb is still a favorite and I plan on picking up the new Gloss Bomb Oil shades tomorrow! The Dior Addict Lip Maximizer is my most-worn and most-reached-for gloss. I’ve been really impressed with the Huda Faux Filler Lip Gloss (swatches here), I think all the colors are flattering and wearable. Pat McGrath remains a favorite for the best smooth non-sticky gloss although so many shades are out of stock, I don’t know if it’s just sold out or being phased out. Tools/Misc For tools I wish there was just one brand I could find all my favorite brushes from, but unfortunately I have to mix tools from different brands. Overall I think the Hourglass brushes are top notch for both powder and cream products. I really love the No 15 Blush Brush for cream brushes and the Vanish Foundation Brush for bases and the Concealer Brush is excellent. I splurged on the travel brush set during a previous sale a few years ago and it was 100% worth the splurge. Ilia brushes are SO under-rated, I hope they expand their brush range. I really love the Sculpting Brush and Finishing Powder Brush. I think the Glossier Lip Liner Sharper is a must. The design to catch the shavings is large enough that you don’t have to empty it every single time. It’s also great for travel. It seems as though a lot of my go-to powder puffs have changed and aren’t as soft as they used to be (I’m talking about repurchases not being the same). I really love the Makeup By Mario Master Pro Puff though. It’s big enough to cover a decent amount on the face without having to dab a million times and it’s ultra soft. Another must-have I swear by is the Sephora Collection Daily Brush Cleaner. Since it’s on the spendy side I usually wash my brushes with Dawn Dish Soap and a scrubbing pad. But for cream products can be difficult to remove all the way. After I give them a rinse with warm water and dish soap. I’ll spritz the Sephora Brush cleaner to soak the brush. If you try it will be AMAZED at how much foundation, cream blush or eyeshadow come out, even AFTER washing it with soap + water. That wraps up my makeup favorites and staples! If you’re shopping the sale let me know what you plan on picking up! I’m hosting a giveaway here on my blog. I’m going to send FIVE readers each a $100 eGift card to Sephora. Open to everyone 18+ but do note that the gift card will be to the Sephora US site only. Follow the steps in the widget below for a chance to win. I’ll pick a winner on Wednesday April 9th and email the winners directly. a Rafflecopter giveaway
html:
I’ve been MIA for the past couple of weeks as I just moved from Tampa to Miami! We’ve all been living out of boxes and moving boxes as we packed everything up for our big move. We are finally in South Beach! I’ll share more soon but you can see a sneak peek of our new place on my LIFE UPDATES highlights on Instagram if you’re curious!

We are slowly but surely settling into our new place and getting everything sorted. Lots of reviews and more beauty content coming your way as I get back into the swing of things. I really miss blogging and trying out new beauty products. I can’t wait to get back into my routine.

The Sephora Savings Event is here this month running from 4/4 through 4/14! Rouge gets first access starting this Friday instore or online with code SAVEMORE. Dates for access:

  • Rouge Members save 20% 4/4 through 4/14
  • VIB Members save 15% off 4/8 through 4/14
  • Insiders save 10% off 4/8 through 4/14
  • All Sephora Collection is 30% off

There are so many great makeup launches these days. I’ll share my absolute tried and true favorites by category and if there’s something new that I tried and loved recently I’ll also list those below.

Best Primers

I’m still not a traditional primer kind of person, but I will use a multi-tasking primer/moisturizer/spf underneath makeup. I still love the Bobbi Brown Vitamin Enriched Face Base and the Charlotte Tilbury Invisible UV Flawless Primer with SPF 50.

If I want something to mix in or add a bit of glow as a base, I still swear by the Charlotte Tilbury Hollywood Flawless Filter (I use Shade 3 or 4.5, swatches here) as a staple, but these days I’ve been really loving the Dior Forever Star Filter (I use Shade 3, swatches + comparisons here) and Saie Glowy Super Gel in Roseglow.

I also really like the new Supergoop! Glowscreen Soft-Radiance Drops which is a mineral formula with SPF40. I’ve been testing out the darker shade Golden Hour but might also pick up Sunrise to try.

Best Concealer

Two favorites I will always repurchase are the Natasha Denona Hy-Glam Concealer for full coverage (still creamy and very easy to blend) or the YSL Touche Eclat. The other ones shown above are also ones I’ve loved, but right now I’ve been sticking to the Natasha Denona one most of the time.

I have been very curious about the Haus Labs Triclone Skin Tech Concealer and will be picking it up during the sale.

Best Foundation/Skin Tints

I love that there wide range of base formulas and coverage for every skin type and preference. My top three most-used foundations from Sephora are the Armani Luminous Silk Foundation (I wear Shade 6.5), Dior Forever Skin Perfect Foundation Stick (I wear 2.5N or 3N, swatches here) and the Westman Atelier Vital Skin Foundation Stick (my shades range from V, VI to VII depending how tan I am).

I also really love the It Cosmetics CC+ Nude Glow. For a more natural looking tint I love the Summer Fridays Skin Tint and Fenty Eaze Drop Blurring Skin Tints.

Best Setting Products

My go-to powder is the Charlotte Tilbury Airbrush Flawless Finish Setting Powder. For a loose setting powder I think the Laura Mercier Translucent Loose Setting Powder remains a classic and I really love the Makeup by Mario Setting Products. I love the way his SurrealSkin Soft Blur Setting Powder looks on the skin (definitely splurge on his puff). His SurrealSkin Soft Setting Spray is also a really good one.

The old version of the Givenchy Prisme Libre was 10/10 but I haven’t looked at the new one after reading so many bad reviews. I do have a few newer ones on my wishlist that I want to check out during the sale including the Givenchy Prisme Libre Pressed Powder, YSL All Hours Hyper Blur Loose and maybe the Kosas Cloud Set Loose Powder.

Best Bronzers/Contour

The best contour products I’ve tried from Sephora are the Rare Beauty Warm Wishes Effortless Cream Bronzer Stick and Westman Atelier Face Trace Contour Stick. These have the best undertones for my skin tone, most other brands run too warm or cool. Swatches + comparisons in this post here.

For a bronzer my favorite has been the Armani Luminous Silk Creamy Bronzing Powder in 100 or 110 (review here). I also still really love the Hourglass Ambient Lighting Bronzer for that soft glowy bronze. Gucci Sun-Kissed Glow Bronzer in Shade 3 is also a really good one.

The Ilia Sunshift Weightless Silky Cream Bronzer is one of my favorite shimmery cream bronzers for the color + finish, but it’s more like a highlighter on my skin rather than a bronzer due to the shimmers. Swatches here.

There are lots of new bronzer formulas I have on my list to try. They’ve been packed away in moving boxes but I hope to review them before the sale ends! I do have the Dior Forever Nude Jumbo Bronzer in 20 and 30. I am curious about the new Haus Labs Powder Sculpt Velvet Powder Bronzers, hoping that one of the new shades will work for me!

Best Blush Formulas

I think I could write an entire series dedicated to blushes. I’m still 100% a powder blush lover. If I could only pick 3 powder blushes to recommend I think the YSL Make Me Blush Powder Blush (review + swatches here) is one of the best new powder blush formulas. I also still really love the Gucci Luminous Matte Beauty Blush (reviewed here and here) and Dior Rosy Glow Blush is also a favorite (swatches here).

Out of the newer blush launches I think the new Tower28 GetSet Blur + Set Matte Powder Blush (swatched here) and Saie SuperSuede Powder Blushes (tried on here) are solid wins. Formulas wear beautifully. I don’t love all the shades they launched but I do really love the colors I tried. The Tower28 is a true matte finish but doesn’t look flat. The Saie SuperSuede has more of a satin finish and it’s easy to layer and blend, but overall has a soft vibe.

For a cream/liquid blush formula Armani Luminous Silk Cheek Tints, Natasha Denona Hy-Blush (review here) and Huda Blush Filter (one reviewed here) are my favorites for the formula and color selection.

I plan on buying some of the new Westman Atelier blush duos during the sale to try!

Highlighters I Love

I’ve been more into glowy blush for a glow rather than a traditional highlighter, but I really love the Dior Forever Glow Maximizers (Nude and Peachy are my favorites, swatches here). The Westman Atelier Super Loaded Tint Peau de Peche highlighter is also a staple – champagne bronzey tones are hard to find for me and this one is just perfect. Swatches in this post here.

Eyeshadow Favorites

My eyeshadow picks are my same go-to’s lately. I feel the need to find something fresh and new to change up my beauty looks, but my top 5 eyeshadow palettes are the Tom Ford Eye Color Quad in Peach Glamour, Tom Ford Golden Hour, Makeup by Mario Master Mattes, Natasha Denona I Need a Warm Nude and the Too Faced Born This Way Natural Nudes.

If I had to pick just one eyeshadow brand to wear Natasha Denona wins hands down. Her palettes are the ones I reach for nearly every single day.

For single shadows I still swear by the Charlotte Tilbury Eyes to Mesmerize (I wear Rose Gold the most) and the Armani Eye Tints in 44S Blush or 22M are my favorites. I think I might pick up a couple more colors during the sale.

Eye Makeup Staples (Liner, Brow, Mascara)

My favorite eyeliners actually aren’t available at Sephora (they’re from Sisley or Victoria Beckham Beauty). But for brows there are TONS of great options at Sephora.

I love Benefit Precisely My Brow (I wear Shade 3), Anastasia Beverly Hills Brow Wiz (Caramel) and Glossier Boy Brow Arch Pencil (Cool Brown) the best for brows. My most-used pencils are from ABH because Caramel is the best color for me. My natural hair color is almost black but my brows are a lot lighter so matching something to my hair usually ends up looking too harsh but Caramel is the best color for me. As much as I love the Glossier one there’s not much product in the pencil and I think I used an entire pencil in 3 weeks.

Best Lip Liners

Now onto my favorite category: lips! I love a good lip pencil and layering lip products are always fun, but these days I have been so low maintenance I usually wear 1 product on my lips at a time.

I still think the Charlotte Tilbury Lip Cheat is the best lip liner for my lip tone. I know everyone probably already owns Pillow Talk, but it’s still my go-to favorite pink neutral (swatches here). I’ve also been really impressed with the Fenty Trace’d Out Longwear Lip Liners (swatches here), Huda Lip Contour 2.0 (swatches here), Glossier Lip Line (swatches of my picks here) and Tom Ford Long Wear Lip Liners (swatches here).

If I could only recommend 2 to try during the sale, I’d say splurge on the Tom Ford or Fenty options. I did pick up some of the Merit Signature Lip Sheer Lip Liners but with my life in moving boxes this past month I haven’t had a chance to try them.

Best Lipsticks

My top 6 lipstick formulas at Sephora include the Tom Ford Lip Color (new formula + colors reviewed here), Fenty Gloss Bomb Stix (I prefer the cream ones reviewed here), Prada Monochrome Soft Matte (I love P158 Meranti), YSL Rouge Pur Couture (swatches + review here), Westman Atelier Lip Suede (review here and also here) and the NARS Afterglow Sensual Shine Hydrating Lipstick.

Best Lip Balms/Oils

YSL makes some of the prettiest tinted lip balms, I love all the formulas, but my favorite is the Candy Glaze (review here and new shades here) or Candy Glow (swatches here) for the best lasting power, pigment and shine.

For a tinted lip balm or oil I have so many favorites. For a squeeze tube format balm the Summer Fridays Lip Butter is always in my bag. I have all the colors but love the Vanilla Beige the most (swatches here). The Gisou Honey Infused Hydrating Lip Oils are super fun but the pigment is ultra sheer (new shades in action here).

For a twist up/click style balm I do still really love the Tarte Maracuja Juicy Lips (all the formulas are great) and the Hourglass Phantom Volumizing Glossy Balm colors cannot be beat (new shades reviewed here).

Best Lip Gloss

For lip gloss I’m still sticking to my top 5 go-to’s! The Fenty Gloss Bomb is still a favorite and I plan on picking up the new Gloss Bomb Oil shades tomorrow! The Dior Addict Lip Maximizer is my most-worn and most-reached-for gloss. I’ve been really impressed with the Huda Faux Filler Lip Gloss (swatches here), I think all the colors are flattering and wearable. Pat McGrath remains a favorite for the best smooth non-sticky gloss although so many shades are out of stock, I don’t know if it’s just sold out or being phased out.

Tools/Misc

For tools I wish there was just one brand I could find all my favorite brushes from, but unfortunately I have to mix tools from different brands. Overall I think the Hourglass brushes are top notch for both powder and cream products. I really love the No 15 Blush Brush for cream brushes and the Vanish Foundation Brush for bases and the Concealer Brush is excellent. I splurged on the travel brush set during a previous sale a few years ago and it was 100% worth the splurge.

Ilia brushes are SO under-rated, I hope they expand their brush range. I really love the Sculpting Brush and Finishing Powder Brush.

I think the Glossier Lip Liner Sharper is a must. The design to catch the shavings is large enough that you don’t have to empty it every single time. It’s also great for travel.

It seems as though a lot of my go-to powder puffs have changed and aren’t as soft as they used to be (I’m talking about repurchases not being the same). I really love the Makeup By Mario Master Pro Puff though. It’s big enough to cover a decent amount on the face without having to dab a million times and it’s ultra soft.

Another must-have I swear by is the Sephora Collection Daily Brush Cleaner. Since it’s on the spendy side I usually wash my brushes with Dawn Dish Soap and a scrubbing pad. But for cream products can be difficult to remove all the way. After I give them a rinse with warm water and dish soap. I’ll spritz the Sephora Brush cleaner to soak the brush. If you try it will be AMAZED at how much foundation, cream blush or eyeshadow come out, even AFTER washing it with soap + water.

That wraps up my makeup favorites and staples! If you’re shopping the sale let me know what you plan on picking up! I’m hosting a giveaway here on my blog. I’m going to send FIVE readers each a $100 eGift card to Sephora. Open to everyone 18+ but do note that the gift card will be to the Sephora US site only. Follow the steps in the widget below for a chance to win. I’ll pick a winner on Wednesday April 9th and email the winners directly.
